documentType: NCIC (National Crime Information Center) inquiry response
summary: This document is an NCIC delayed response inquiry from the FBI New York office to the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services regarding a protection order file search. It details restrictions from a protection order including staying away from protected persons, no communication, firearm prohibitions, and temporary custody awards.

persons.name: Michael C. Green
persons.role: Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services
persons.context: Listed as the executive deputy commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services, which is the agency responding to the FBI's NCIC inquiry.

events.title: NCIC Protection Order File Inquiry
events.description: The FBI New York office submitted a delayed response inquiry to the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services for a search of the NCIC Protection Order File.

locations: Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan St. Albany, New York 12210
Los Angeles, CA (referenced in ORI: LOS ANGELES CO SO LOS ANGELES)
keyFacts: The FBI New York office conducted an NCIC search for a protection order file, indicating ongoing investigative interest in someone subject to such an order.

The protection order includes multiple restrictions: staying away from protected persons' residences/property/school/work, no communication, prohibition on possessing/purchasing firearms or weapons, and temporary exclusive custody of children awarded to the protected person.
The document references Los Angeles County Sheriff's Office (ORI: LOS ANGELES CO SO LOS ANGELES) as the originating agency for the protection order data.
The response includes a federal warning about unauthorized release of NCIC information, highlighting the sensitive nature of the data.
The document is dated October 6, 2021, showing post-Epstein death investigative activity.
